titleStmt.title: The court of Rome. Wherein is sett forth the whole government thereof; all the officers belonging unto it, with the value of their offices, as they are sold by the Pope also the originall, creation and present condition of the cardinals : together with the manner of the now Pope Innocent the tenth's election; coronation, and hiding in state to take possession of his lateranense church. Besides many other remarkable matters most worthy to be knowne. And a direction for such as shall travell to Rome, how they may with most ease, and commoditie view all those rarities, curiosities, and antiquities, which are to be seene there. / Translated out of Italian into English by H.C. Gent.
titleStmt.author: Cogan, Henry, translator.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Henry Herringman, and are to be sold at his shop at the Anchor in the Lower walke of the New Exchange,

notesStmt.note: A translation, by Henry Cogan, of the Italian original.
"A direction for such as shall travell unto Rome" has separate dated title page; register and pagination are continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
